Hes not implying J4 should be able to drop a cataclysm where ever he wants. Its that ecko, thresh, and J4 all require the caster to enter the AoE. Ecko's W doesn't do damage either. J4 can block allies from escaping. Both Thresh's and J4's ult do damage yes, but its not like Veigar's E damage or Brands W's damage. Veigars W has more range then Thresh and J4's ults 2! So.... how is Veigar's W fair compared to these abilities which require so much more skill and positioning.

Skill and positioning?  J4's ult is point and click, and Thresh just wants to throw his up anywhere between the opponent and his ADC.  Veigar CANNOT reliably land Dark Matter AT ALL without first making sure his stun actually hits someone.  For teamfights, it might be just as good to trap them in the middle, but paying attention means the opponent can still avoid it altogether because of the delay.

J4 does not have a delay, and does not have to aim.  He just picks the target he wants and ults them.  Ekko has mobility to dodge and a wide stun of his own.  Thresh is only ulting to keep people away from his ADC.  Veigar has to aim his stun, has no mobility to dodge away from YOU if you dodge his stun, and he loses a ton of damage if his stun only acts as a zoning tool.  NONE of them are actually comparable to one another.

I know, making sure Veigar landed his stun is very hard. I do agree Dark Matter is rarely hit without his stun. The delay is very short though, making it reletively hard dodge. J4 shouldn't have a delay or it would never work. Not having to "aim" actually makes it harder. Veigars stun is not hard to 'aim" while Thresh's,J4's,and Ecko's abilities requires them to position themselves in order to land it, thus putting themselves in danger. Ekko's stun has 3 second delay, 3 times longer then Veigars, and requires him not only to aim like viegar's but also to get himself inside the circle. 

Veigar's stun is like Zed's shadow. When your away from turret you just farm. You dont use your escape. Veigar can just stun you when you gank. His stun doesn't require skill AT ALL to hit and if you cant hit your Dark Matter without you stun ever, you need to practice Veigar.
